caption:
This photograph depicts a large, weathered wooden structure amid a dense, lush forest. The structure has several vertical and slanted beams, resembling an old forest watchtower or possibly remnants of a mining scaffold. The tower-like structure seems abandoned and partially deteriorated, with nature slowly reclaiming the space as mosses and plants grow over and around the wood.

The surrounding forest is thick, filled with various species of trees, predominantly bare deciduous trees and some evergreens. The forest ground is covered in green vegetation and dead leaves, portraying a moist, temperate woodland environment. The light filtering through the trees suggests that this image was captured on a cloudy day or under a canopy thick enough to diffuse direct sunlight. No people or animals are visible, and the scene conveys a sense of quiet and remoteness, untouched by recent human activity.
title: An old railroad tressel at the edge of a revene in a mixed alder and Douglas fir growth. Near the Olympic National Park in the Olympic National Timberland, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. April, 1973.
